casebody.data:
JOHN I. DAVENPORT v. THE UNITED STATES.

[No opinion in C. Cls. R.; not reported in U. S. R.]

On the defendants’ Appeal. Claimant was a commissioner of the United States Circuit Court for the southern district of New Yori, and recovered judgment for $467.90 in the court below for services rendered and expenses incurred as chief supervisor of elections in said district, as follows: For entering and indexing oaths of special deputy marshals. For entering and indexing the supervisors' returns of the canvass of votes cast.

The decision of the court below is affirmed by a divided court without opinion, January 28, 1895.
